job.title: Business Development Leader - Google (34233)
job.description:
We are seeking an accomplished and results-driven sales leader to accelerate growth within our technology business. This pivotal role will focus on uncovering and winning new business opportunities, while deepening our engagement and influence within the Google technology space. You will be instrumental in shaping and executing our go-to-market approach, collaborating with internal teams across sales, delivery, and partnerships to bring impactful solutions to clients.

Leveraging your deep knowledge of Google’s offerings and your ability to sell complex, solution-based services, you will establish credibility quickly, identify value-creation opportunities, and harness our organization’s full technology capabilities to address our clients’ most critical needs.

Key Responsibilities

  • Proactively identify, pursue, and develop new client relationships in targeted accounts.

  • Partner with cross-functional teams to lead pursuit strategies and sales initiatives.

  • Build strong, trust-based relationships with decision-makers and influencers at prospective and existing clients.

  • Establish and maintain collaborative relationships with key contacts within Google, ensuring alignment and joint growth opportunities.

  • Support the development and execution of a targeted Google partnership strategy aligned to business goals.

  • Work with clients to understand business challenges and design tailored, high-impact solutions using the organization’s complete service portfolio.

  • Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to design and deliver effective go-to-market programs.

  • Represent the company at industry events, partner functions, and strategic meetings to showcase capabilities and identify new opportunities.

Success Indicators

  • Demonstrates integrity, collaboration, and professionalism in every client and partner interaction.

  • Develops a strong understanding of client industries, priorities, and challenges, earning recognition as a trusted advisor.

  • Engages curiosity and strategic thinking to diagnose client needs and deliver actionable solutions.

  • Promotes a collaborative and inclusive environment that inspires top performance.

  • Adopts and champions digital tools, data-driven selling, and innovative business practices.

  • Continues to expand market and technical expertise through ongoing learning.

Qualifications

  • Proven track record of building trust and credibility with stakeholders at all levels within client and partner organizations.

  • Demonstrated success in generating new business, leading strategic pursuits, and closing complex deals.

  • Strong background and hands-on experience in the Google ecosystem, including knowledge of product capabilities and partner programs.

  • 10+ years of progressive sales or business development experience within mid-market and enterprise environments.

  • Documented success selling professional services, cloud-based solutions, or digital transformation initiatives.

  • Highly results-oriented with a proactive, solution-focused approach to business challenges.

  • Experience selling across multiple industries in the Canadian market is an asset.

  • Post-secondary education or equivalent professional experience.

  • Team-oriented mindset with an appreciation for individual contributions to collective success.

job.title: Director of Information Technology – Cloud Technology & Infrastructure (34234)
job.description:
We are looking for a forward-thinking IT leader to guide our technology operations and spearhead the strategic growth of our cloud-first environment. This role will oversee the planning, delivery, and continual improvement of enterprise IT services, with a strong focus on cloud platforms, SaaS applications, and modern infrastructure solutions. You’ll have the opportunity to shape technology direction in a dynamic, expanding organization while staying hands-on with critical initiatives.
The successful candidate will combine leadership, technical expertise, and business alignment to ensure our technology landscape remains secure, scalable, and optimized for performance. This is both a strategic and execution-focused position, requiring a proven ability to deliver results in a high-growth setting.

Key Responsibilities
  • Lead, mentor, and inspire the IT team to foster innovation, accountability, and collaboration.
  • Manage and optimize cloud platforms and applications, including Microsoft 365, AWS, and Azure, ensuring alignment with organizational priorities.
  • Oversee the delivery of IT projects such as infrastructure upgrades, security enhancements, and modernization programs.
  • Maintain the security, availability, and scalability of network and cloud environments through best practices and proactive risk management.
  • Drive process improvements through automation, integration, and innovative technology solutions.
  • Establish and enforce IT policies, compliance measures, and security standards to protect organizational data and systems.
  • Partner with senior leadership to define and execute a technology roadmap that supports business growth.
  • Provide hands-on support for high-priority issues and initiatives to minimize operational disruptions.
  • Stay ahead of emerging technologies and industry developments to maintain a competitive edge.

Qualifications
  • 7+ years of progressive IT experience, including at least 3 years in a leadership role.
  • Deep knowledge of cloud services, infrastructure, and enterprise technology ecosystems.
  • Strong technical foundation in networking, security, and systems administration.
  • Demonstrated success in delivering complex IT projects in evolving or scaling organizations.
  • Solid understanding of cybersecurity, compliance frameworks, and risk management practices.
  • Proven leadership and communication skills with the ability to inspire and manage high-performing teams.
  • Strategic mindset with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to align IT initiatives to business outcomes.
  • Experience identifying cost efficiencies, automation opportunities, and process improvements in cloud environments.

job.title: Project Manager (34236)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Project Manager for 12+ Months Contract role. (Potential of Extension).

IMPORTANT NOTE: Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week. Local candidates only - Candidates must be located within 2 hours of Lansing, MI at time of submission.

Top Skills & Years of Experience:
- 5+ years overall experience
- Experience with the ADKAR (Prosci) Framework
- Proven ability to lead large, cross-functional teams and manage high-visibility projects with medium to high risk.
- Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills with experience interacting with Agency Leadership.
- Ability to manage both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
- Demonstrated success managing vendor-supported projects with integrated technical components and stakeholder groups.

Job Summary:
The State of Michigan is seeking an experienced and dynamic Senior Project Manager to lead complex, large-scale IT initiatives. This role requires a strong blend of project management expertise, leadership capabilities, technical awareness, and change management proficiency to ensure successful project outcomes aligned with business objectives and enterprise standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide strategic oversight, leadership, and accountability for one or more large, complex IT projects, typically lasting longer than 6 months, involving 20 or more team members, and requiring executive-level communication and coordination.
  • Ensure alignment with State of Michigan project management methodologies, including SUITE, investment management, and systems engineering methodology.
  • Lead cross-functional teams through all phases of project planning and execution, including the development of integrated schedules, risk management plans, and budget tracking.
  • Monitor and report on project progress regarding scope, quality, schedule, and budget, and escalate issues and risks to executive leadership as necessary.
  • Perform long-term release planning to support organizational strategic goals and ensure alignment with broader enterprise initiatives.
  • Evaluate technical requirements in collaboration with IT and business stakeholders, proposing solutions that meet business needs while adhering to SOM best practices and industry standards.
  • Apply structured change management practices grounded in the ADKAR (Prosci) framework to ensure stakeholder alignment and successful adoption of project deliverables.


Technical Competencies:
  • Strong knowledge of APIs, system interfaces, and multi-system integrations across complex IT environments.
  • Working knowledge of IT infrastructure components and their interactions within networked environments (e.g., firewalls, VIPs, F5 listeners, ports).
  • Familiarity with core infrastructure environments including networks, servers, storage, web platforms, and virtual/cloud solutions.
  • Ability to effectively collaborate with technical teams and external vendors to support solution design, integration, deployment, and issue resolution.


Change Management and Stakeholder Engagement: This position plays a critical role in driving change adoption through:
  • Integration of change management principles from the outset of the project.
  • Close collaboration with stakeholder engagement leads to develop and implement communication plans, facilitate training sessions, and monitor organizational readiness.
  • Supporting stakeholders at every level to reduce resistance, align expectations, and ensure long-term user adoption of new systems and processes.


Ideal Candidate Profile:
  • Proven ability to lead large, cross-functional teams and manage high-visibility projects with medium to high risk.
  • Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills with experience interacting with Agency Leadership.
  • Ability to manage both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
  • Demonstrated success managing vendor-supported projects with integrated technical components and stakeholder groups.

job.title: Content Annotation Specialist (34248)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Wichita, KS, is seeking a Content Annotation Specialist for a hybrid contract position.

Shift Time: 8-5 and 30-40 hours per week

NOTE: W2 Only!

Job Responsibilities:

The position will be utilizing marked up Word documents to analyze changes from prior versions and template version to determine the changes needed to integrate the new version of dynamic forms within an audit "title" for approximately 20 titles. Candidates should be familiar with Word and Excel. Basic understanding of XML is recommended but not required. Must be able to quickly adapt to new systems. High-level attention to detail is a must. Needs ability to produce quality output under tight deadlines. Receive on-the-job training and direction from more experienced staff to ensure requisite learning is achieved and utilized to complete assignments. Business knowledge of auditing is a bonus.


Required Skills/Experience/Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree. 
• Analytical and detail-oriented mindset. 
• Strong organizational skills and proficiency with Microsoft Office 365 suite. 
• Familiarity with content management systems. 
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. 
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. 
• Flexibility, responsiveness to change, and a proactive attitude. 
• Able to adhere to production and process standards within a content team.

job.title: SAP CM/OCM Consultant (S/4HANA) (34250)
job.description:
Our Vancouver based clinet is looking for an experienced SAP Change/Organizational Change Management (CM/OCM) Consultant to support a fast-moving SAP S/4HANA transformation. This is an urgent backfill. You will lead change strategy and execution across stakeholder engagement, communications, training, and adoption—partnering closely with program leadership and functional workstreams.  HYBRID ON SITE VANCOUVER

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the change management strategy and integrated plan for an S/4HANA program.

  • Drive stakeholder analysis, change impact assessments, and readiness activities.

  • Build and run the communications plan (executive and end-user messaging, artifacts).

  • Define and execute the training strategy (curriculum, delivery approach, enablement).

  • Establish adoption KPIs/OKRs, track readiness, and report progress to leadership/PMO.

  • Stand up and manage the change agent/super-user network; support cutover & hypercare.

  • Coordinate with PMO, SAP functional leads, and business sponsors to align scope, timeline, and risks.

  • Be on-site in Vancouver weekly to facilitate workshops and key change activities.

Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience leading enterprise ERP change/transformation programs, with hands-on SAP S/4HANA exposure.

  • Strong delivery across impact assessments, comms, training, adoption, and readiness.

  • Excellent facilitation, executive communication, and stakeholder management skills.

  • Prosci/ADKAR or equivalent methodology experience (asset).

  • Mining industry experience is an asset.

  • Able to travel to Vancouver weekly; work primarily remote otherwise.

  • Eligible to work in Canada.

job.title: Product Security Architect (34252)
job.description:
Product Security Architect

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Product Security Architect to join our team and help secure next-generation satellite systems. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Product Security, you will be responsible for embedding security throughout the product lifecycle — from design and development to deployment and operations — ensuring the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of our space and ground-based assets.

Main Responsibilities

  • Threat Modeling & Risk Assessment: Conduct threat modeling and security risk assessments for satellite hardware, software, and communication systems.

  • Secure Design & Architecture: Collaborate with engineering teams to design secure systems, including onboard satellite software, ground control systems, and data links.

  • Vulnerability Management: Evaluate and support remediation efforts related to vulnerabilities in embedded systems, firmware, and satellite communication protocols.

  • Security Testing: Propose test use cases and review testing results for assessments such as penetration testing, fuzzing, and static/dynamic code analysis on satellite and ground systems.

  • Compliance & Standards: Ensure compliance with industry standards/frameworks such as NIST, ISO 27001, and space-specific cybersecurity frameworks (e.g., CCSDS, CNSSI 1253).

  • Incident Response: Create concepts of operation for incident detection, analysis, and response to security events affecting satellite products.

  • Tooling & Automation: Ensure the software development lifecycle follows industry best practices and utilize appropriate security tools to automate security checks.

  • Collaboration: Work cross-functionally with software, hardware, systems, and mission assurance teams to champion security best practices.

Education/Experience

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Cybersecurity, or a related field.

  • 10+ years of experience in product or embedded security architecture.

  • Experience in the aerospace or satellite industry.

  • Certifications such as CISSP, OSCP, CEH, or GIAC.

Specialized Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Strong understanding of embedded systems security, real-time operating systems (RTOS), and secure communications.

  • Knowledge of space system architectures, including satellite buses, payloads, and ground stations.

  • Extensive understanding of the space industry threat landscape.

  • Experience with security tools (e.g., SAST, DAST, Splunk).

  • Knowledge of cybersecurity frameworks (e.g., NIST 800-53, ISO/IEC 27001).

  • Familiarity with space situational awareness (SSA) and anti-jamming/anti-spoofing techniques.

  • Experience with DevSecOps in aerospace environments.

job.title: Technical Lead – FPGA & Real-Time Systems (2 Positions) (34258)
job.description:
Technical Lead – FPGA & Real-Time Systems

We are looking for an experienced FPGA Technical Lead to guide high-performance design and development projects. This is a hands-on leadership role focused on technical direction rather than people management. You’ll work closely with architects, hardware/software teams, and product leaders to deliver cutting-edge systems used in large-scale, real-time environments.

What You’ll Do
  • Lead FPGA design activities including RTL development, verification, and optimization.
  • Collaborate with system and product architects to define design specifications.
  • Drive efficiency and reliability in high-volume real-time processing (video, audio, or imaging).
  • Ensure delivery milestones are met, flagging issues early and helping the team stay on track.
  • Provide technical input on toolsets, methodologies, and best practices.
  • Participate in design reviews, release planning, and technical hiring decisions.
  • Mentor team members and contribute to knowledge sharing.

What You Bring
  • 5+ years of FPGA & hardware development experience in production environments.
  • Proven expertise in RTL design, FPGA building blocks, and high-speed interfaces (DDR4/5, PCIe, transceivers, PLLs).
  • Strong Verilog/SystemVerilog coding and verification skills; familiarity with C/C++ is an asset.
  • Hands-on experience with Xilinx (AMD) and Intel (Altera) FPGA devices and toolchains.
  • Background in real-time systems (RTOS), ideally with video, audio, or imaging data.
  • Knowledge of data compression, parallel processing, and 4K optimization.
  • Experience building solutions for mass production, not just prototypes or research.
  • Strong communication, organizational, and leadership skills.
  • Degree in Engineering or related field (or equivalent technical experience).

Why Join
This is an opportunity to play a pivotal role in developing next-generation FPGA solutions for high-volume, real-time applications. You’ll have the chance to lead technically, solve complex challenges, and help shape products from concept to production.

job.title: FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer, Intermediate (2 Positions) (34259)
job.description:
FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer
 

We are seeking an FPGA/Hardware Engineer to help design and optimize advanced media transport and processing systems for high-performance video, audio, and data applications. This role involves hands-on design, testing, and support of production-grade solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop FPGA-based solutions for video/audio transport and real-time processing (SMPTE ST 2110/IP, SDI).

  • Implement and optimize RTL designs, with a focus on 4K performance, data compression, and parallel processing.

  • Support hardware testing, debugging, and validation in lab environments.

  • Contribute to new product introduction (NPI) through design, documentation, and test activities.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams on requirements, component selection, and technical documentation.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years of FPGA or hardware design experience (video/audio focus preferred).

  • Hands-on experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGA platforms and design tools.

  • Proficiency with SystemVerilog (preferred), VHDL, or HLS; scripting in TCL/SDC.

  • Familiarity with high-speed interfaces (Ethernet, DDR), transceivers, and timing analysis.

  • Strong problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills.

Nice to Have

  • Exposure to Linux-based development and programming in C/C++ or Python.

  • Knowledge of digital video/audio standards (SDI, AES, NMOS) and broadcast workflows.

  • Experience with packet processing, routing protocols, or PTP synchronization.

job.title: Senior, FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer (2 Positions) (34260)
job.description:
Senior FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer

We’re looking for a seasoned FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer to help architect and deliver next-generation solutions for high-performance video and data applications. This role involves taking projects from concept through to production, with a strong focus on efficiency, optimization, and real-time system performance.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead FPGA and hardware design efforts, from architecture through testing and validation.

  • Define requirements, select components, and contribute to schematic/board design decisions.

  • Develop, verify, and debug FPGA-based solutions (including UHD-SDI, high-speed transceivers, DDR interfaces, etc.).

  • Support the full product development lifecycle (design, QA, documentation, customer-facing support).

  • Collaborate across teams to ensure high-performance, production-ready solutions.

What You Bring

  • Strong background in RTL design and FPGA development (VHDL/Verilog).

  • Experience with real-time operating systems (RTOS), ideally in video, audio, or image processing.

  • Proven ability in high-volume data processing, compression, and parallel processing for 4K optimization.

  • Hands-on expertise with modern FPGA platforms (Xilinx, Intel/Altera) and related tools.

  • Familiarity with SoC integration, clock domain analysis, and timing closure.

  • Solid understanding of circuit design (power, signal integrity, microprocessor design).

  • Proficiency in debugging with lab tools (oscilloscopes, analyzers, WFMs, etc.).

  • Additional experience with C/C++/Java, scripting, and broadcast workflows is a plus.

job.title: Senior FPGA / RTL Design Engineer - EDGE Technologies (2 Positions) (34261)
job.description:
Senior FPGA / RTL Design Engineer

Overview

We are seeking an experienced FPGA / RTL Design Engineer to join our development team. This role is focused on architecting and delivering advanced FPGA solutions in high-performance, production-grade environments. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to design, verify, and optimize systems used in data-intensive, real-time applications.

Key Responsibilities

  • Architect, design, simulate, and test advanced FPGA-based solutions.

  • Define high-level design requirements and support product development.

  • Collaborate with hardware, software, and verification teams to validate designs.

  • Lead technical design reviews and resolve complex issues.

  • Produce high-quality documentation to support new product introduction.

  • Participate in Agile/Scrum ceremonies and contribute to continuous improvement.

  • Mentor junior team members and share technical expertise.

Core Skills & Experience

  • 6+ years of FPGA development experience; background with video/audio systems an asset.

  • Strong RTL design skills using Verilog/SystemVerilog.

  • Expertise in FPGA workflows (RTL capture, synthesis, timing closure, prototyping, release).

  • Hands-on debugging with simulations and in-FPGA logic analyzers.

  • Familiarity with SoC interconnects (AXI, Avalon), high-speed protocols (PCIe, Ethernet, HDMI, SDI, DisplayPort), and compression standards (e.g., HEVC, AVC).

  • Knowledge of FPGA development tools such as Vivado and Quartus.

  • Additional programming knowledge (C, C++, Python) considered an advantage.

What We’re Looking For

  • Strong problem-solving ability with a focus on performance, efficiency, and optimization.

  • Organized, detail-oriented, and capable of working independently or in a team.

  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain technical concepts to diverse audiences.

  • A degree in Engineering (or equivalent experience).

job.title: AWS Cloud/DevOps Engineer (34262)
job.description:
Title: AWS Cloud/DevOps Engineer
Location: Chicago, IL 60604 (Hybrid, 4 days onsite/week)
Duration: 1 Year contract (Possible extension)

*NOTE: W2 Contract ONLY, 

TOP 3 skills:
  1. Experience with CI/build tools, Pipelines
  2. AWS Cloud
  3. CI/CD (GitLab)

Nice to Have:
  1. Terraform
  2. Scripting (PowerShell/Python)
  3. Some development background

Description
The Senior Cloud/DevOps Engineer leads the design, maintenance, transition to, and operations of cloud platforms. The Engineer collaborates with stakeholders to obtain and translate business requirements into technical implementations and provides guidance to technical teams regarding architectural and procedural best practices and functional experience. This position is considered advanced level and performs work of moderate to high complexity. The incumbent works under general supervision and may lead some efforts autonomously. This position does not have any direct reports but may lead or mentor of junior staff.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Leads the technical design, maintenance, and operation of cloud-based platforms.
  • Leads automation efforts to minimize manual work and ensure transparency in all aspects of the secure cloud ecosystem.
  • Implements hybrid IT by integrating different cloud services with back-end, traditional data center services.
  • Migrates legacy applications to public cloud services in a rehosting approach or in a revising approach for efficiency, agility, and disaster recovery.
  • Partners with stakeholders to obtain and translate requirements into technical implementations.
  • Integrates existing legacy systems with proposed systems by identifying gaps between the current and future state.
  • Oversees and develops continuous delivery framework and tools.
  • Develops testing use cases and detailed testing plans that map to the documented business and technical requirements.
  • Leads technical and end-user resources to execute detailed tests and analyze testing results.
  • Assists with implementation of customer side monitoring tools and may lead operation outage events.
  • Provides timely/responsive technical support including rotational on call support.

job.title: SAP EWM Lead (Contract) – Hybrid Winnipeg (34267)
job.description:
We’re seeking an experienced SAP EWM Lead to drive warehousing design and delivery for a large S/4HANA program. This role is a long term, client-facing, hands-on, and requires frequent onsite presence in Winnipeg.

Responsibilities

  • Lead EWM solution design & build across inbound, outbound, and internal processes

  • Configure warehouse structures (Storage Types/Sections, Activity Areas), RF, POSC/LOSC, WOCR, picking/putaway strategies

  • Integrate EWM with MM and SD; partner with process & technical teams on end-to-end flows

  • Run workshops, create business blueprints, document requirements, and present to stakeholders

  • Troubleshoot complex issues; provide cutover and hypercare leadership

Required Qualifications

  • 10+ years SAP EWM experience

  • 3+ full lifecycle EWM implementations in a consulting capacity

  • Proven, hands-on configuration across all core EWM areas listed above

  • Strong client-facing communication & presentation skills; ability to translate technical to business language

  • Solid analytical/problem-solving skills; proactive, collaborative, accountable, able to work independently

Nice to Have

  • Industry exposure in Power & Utilities, Oil & Gas, Energy

  • S/4HANA EWM 2023 experience

Work Model

  • Hybrid Winnipeg: up to 4 days/week on site (approx. 75% travel required)

job.title: Senior ASIC Product Engineer (34268)
job.description:
Myticas is seeking a highly skilled and motivated ASIC Product Engineer to join our clients team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing specifications and validation methods for Analog ASICs used in datacenter transceiver products. This role involves close collaboration with multiple teams on product definition, requirements, specifications, DVT, qualification, test, and production ramp-up. The ideal candidate will be proactive, able to anticipate problems, and devise effective solutions.
 

 
HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AND WHAT YOU WILL LEARN
  • Translate system requirements for datacenter communication ICs into detailed specifications and ensure compliance through design, test, and validation processes.
  • Develop and maintain application notes to support the integration of these ICs.
  • Serve as the liaison between the ASIC design team and module-level HW integration and test teams.
  • Drive the supply of prototype ASICs for performance and reliability validation activities.
  • Perform statistical data analysis on large datasets to characterize and improve product performance.
  • Track, troubleshoot, and resolve IC issues in collaboration with the design team.
  • Evaluate capabilities, yields, and supply planning in preparation for volume ramp following product release.
KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
  • Proven experience in product engineering, working cross-functionally to bring ASICs to market through multiple development cycles.
  • Experience working with analog ASICs with proven ability to evaluate performance and lead failure analysis
  • Strong understanding of device physics and its impact on analog circuits, with techniques to improve performance.
  • Proficiency in working with large datasets, performing statistical analysis, and presenting data and ideas to diverse audiences.
  • Excellent organizational and information management skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to enhance proficiency through programming skills and process development.

job.title: Senior IT Program Manager (34269)
job.description:
Job Title: Senior IT Program Manager
Location: Waukegan, IL (Hybrid – 3 days onsite)
Duration: 1 Year+ Contract (Possible further extension)
  
Job Summary
One of our Direct clients is looking to add Sr IT Program Manager to their team who will responsible for develop, execute, and manage multiple IT projects/programs within their defined scope(s).
Manage a multitude of interrelated project activities and lead all aspects of the project lifecycle, working with project sponsors/key stakeholders, team members, and management to oversee all phases of project completion.
Build and manage project’s work breakdown structure, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the project.
 
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • 5+ years of experience in IT PROGRAM management.
  • Experience managing SDLC projects.
 
Preferred Qualifications:
  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Experience with managing AI projects.

job.title: Electrical Engineer - Power Equipment and Controls (34272)
job.description:
Electrical Engineer III
Louisville, CO
100% on site role - in office presence required

Benefits: Access to Client Benefits Package
Pay Range: $115,000-$150,000

POSITION SUMMARY

Seeking an Electrical Engineer III to join our client’s team in the energy, mining, industrial power markets, and Integrated bio-energy solutions. The Electrical Engineer III will research, develop, design, and test electrical components, equipment and systems including power / control systems, applying principles and techniques of electrical engineering.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Design electrical equipment, facilities, components, products, and systems for industrial purposes.
  • Design and direct personnel in fabrication of control apparatus and equipment, and determine methods, procedures, and conditions for testing products such as generators, transformers, control devices, motors, conveyors, power distribution, and safety systems.
  • Develop applications of controls, instruments, and systems for industrial uses, including motors and conveyance systems; lead activities to ensure that manufacturing, construction, installation, and operation conform to functional specifications and customer requirements.
  • Direct and coordinate operation, maintenance and repair of equipment and systems in field installations utilizing computer-assisted engineering and design software and equipment to perform engineering tasks.
  • Perform specific and limited portions of a broader assignment of an experienced engineer. Lead a single group of Engineers, Designers and Technicians.
  • Independently evaluate, select, and apply standard practices and techniques in specific situations, adjust and correlate data, recognize discrepancies in the results, and follow operations through a series of related detailed steps or processes.
  • Ability to design a complete standard electrical engineering drawings package, which includes, power one-lines, control schematics, control panel layouts with bills of material, interconnection diagrams, cable schedules, cable tray design criteria, and cable tray drawings.
  • Ability to create program projects, modify, debug PLC software, and understand the various communication networks used.
  • Serve as the primary electrical resource for the installation and start-up of the assignment.
  • Ability to manage electrical contractors along with Modular Fabrication resources to complete unitized and pre-assembled work.
  • Collaborate with the estimation department to create and execute project estimations.
  • Work with project management to create schedules for assignments. Manage electrical portion of some projects.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering is required.
  • 5-7+ years of experience in electrical engineering is required.
  • Power experience is a plus (i.e. power distribution centers, motor control centers, large frequency drives, medium voltage )
  • Project management experience
  • AutoCAD and drafting experience beyond a basic level is preferred.
  • Experience developing drawings for fabrication of wire way systems are preferred.
  • Experience with selection and specification of switch gear, motor control centers, large generators, medium to high voltage transformers, water systems, support equipment and/or HVAC equipment is preferred.
  • Strong mechanical aptitude and hands-on experience are preferred.
  • Process knowledge of P&ID’s.
  • Excellent communication skills are required.
  • EIT registration is preferred.
  • Microsoft Office proficiency


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Site Management Supervisor (34276)
job.description:
Site Management Supervisor
Location: Denver, CO / Hybrid

Rate: $57.69-$72.11/hr.
Benefits: Medical, Dental, & Vision

**** This position includes a company vehicle with paid fuel. Candidate must be located within an hour of the Winter Park, CO area.

Qualifications:

  • Candidate must have a Level “A” wastewater license for the state of Colorado.
  • High school diploma.
  • 6 years’ experience at an industrial water/wastewater treatment facility, or municipal water/wastewater facility public works operation, including experience in project management with responsibility for technical support and financial accountability or 6 years working in a related field.
  • Understanding of industrial operations including basic fluid flow, process equipment, and control instrumentation.
  • Three years of experience at a supervisory level.
  • Ability to travel 10% of the time.
  • Possess a valid driver’s license with no major infractions.
  • Proficient with computer software including Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, Teams), PDF software, etc.
  • Ability to perform daily computer skills managing various client software programs, SCADA, and data entry.
  • Possess sufficient virtual communication skills to successfully maintain operations and regulatory compliance while located remote from client sites.
  • Candidate needs to be able to read, understand, and abide by Industrial Regulations and Standards.
  • Candidate needs to be able to read, understand, abide by, and guide their team in compliance with client safety, quality, and other requirements.
  • Candidate must live in Winter Park, CO, or a nearby community

Responsibilities:

  • Manage staff for two locations in Colorado for a private-sector industrial client.
  • Organize and direct all onsite contract operations teams (projects) within the assigned portfolio.
  • Provide clients with effective performance in compliance with local, state, and federal regulatory agency water quality permit requirements.
  • Create a safe work culture and ensure safe work practices are followed by all staff.
  • Maintain assigned sites in Operational and Regulatory compliance.
  • Provide support, mentoring, training, and leadership to assure the highest possible effort on the part of onsite managers, local staff, and operators in the region.
  • Ensure staff stays on task and completes job related duties.
  • Assure personnel compliance with corporate reporting systems and customer reporting systems.
  • Lead O&M personnel development and training program to drive professional advancement within the organization.
  • Implement O&M training programs to develop all levels of associates at regional sites, recommend new training requirements, undertake to advance professional skills, mentor new project managers and members of the contract operating teams with a written plan.
  • Assure the implementation of all required training programs and performance reviews for new and existing projects.
  • Lead O&M Safety, Maintenance, Process Control, cost/savings, process optimization, and Sustainability efforts in the assigned portfolio.
  • Participate in the selection, assignment, and orientation of all onsite supervisors and motivate extraordinary, self-starting effort by onsite supervisors.
  • Support affirmative action and diversity efforts in the assigned portfolio.
  • Assure O&M management of the proper execution of job performance interviews and in the continuing communication of management policies to all personnel.
  • Develop all of the technical skills to function as an onsite manager and are prepared to perform these functions during project start up as well as during emergency situations.
  • Verify and complete all job-related documents and reports.
  • Maintain quality of operations and deliverables at the levels expected by client, including achievement of Key Performance Indicators (KPI) where applicable.
  • Frequently travel to sites for Client meetings, Inspections, and Operational Compliance.
  • Provide support with business development of contract operations and other efforts.
  • Report on all competitive contract services sales efforts and advises marketing personnel of these efforts and prepare other reports and presentations as required.
  • Provide primary client relationship with client management and technical personnel and report regularly as to client confidence, satisfaction, and/or problems.
  • Review monthly contract service reports for each installation, advising management as to project status, regulatory agency permit compliance, and technical/plant management attitudes.
  • Support regional personnel with the handling of local problems and in the development of client relations strategies to assure successful on-going business at each site.
  • Develop budgets and assist in the preparation of operations strategies to achieve compliance with regulatory agency requirements and O&M corporate objectives.
  • Review all monthly project reports and utilize these materials to more effectively manage O&M client services and to assure O&M's compliance with all contract provisions and client understanding and satisfaction of services rendered.
  • Actively participate in regional and local professional groups, and reports on any technology or service advancements desired by local groups and/or O&M clients.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Senior Electrical Engineer (34279)
job.description:
Senior Electrical Engineer
Location: Dallas / Fort Worth Area, TX (Hybrid)
Direct Hire
Rate: $50 - $98 / hr.
Benefits: Access to full company benefits package.

 

As a Senior Electrical Engineer in the Dallas Forth-Worth area, your primary focus will be on leading an electrical engineering team to provide advisory services and engineering design solutions for clients across all market sectors.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Collaboration with our Client Account Managers and Sales Professionals on pursuits of strategic importance to the firm.
  • Anticipating challenges and managing “up and out” while supporting large teams responsible for the daily details of project delivery.
  • Using highly collaborative and sophisticated communication and problem-solving skills.

What you’ll bring:

  • Bachelor's or Advanced Degree in Electrical Engineering, Electrical Power Engineering or related engineering discipline.
  • Professional Engineering licensure (any US state), with the ability to acquire a license in additional states if required for a particular project.
  • Minimum of 8 years of engineering design and/or consulting experience.
  • Power distribution systems and microgrids
  • Power generation projects exceeding 10MW capacity.
  • HV or MV Substations
  • Renewable energy projects including wind, solar, hydro, geothermal and other technologies.
  • Energy storage systems
  • Power system modeling experience using SKM Power Tools, ETAP or similar modeling software.
  • Protection and Control, SCADA or power system automation
  • Campus utility master planning or decarbonization/climate response planning
  • Cogeneration or combined heat and power systems
  • Thermal utility plants and distribution systems (steam, hot water, chilled water)
  • Proven ability to engage with clients, develop relationships and win work, then deliver innovative solutions providing value to both the client and provider.
  • Demonstrated ability to engage in business growth strategy, including exploration and development of new project opportunities, including knowledge and application of new and emerging technologies.
  • Experience with proposal development and project execution planning, including scope development and manhour estimates for engineering services.
  • Passion for mentoring and development of junior technical staff.
  • Strong communication and technical writing skills

Other Details:

  • Availability to travel as required to support project needs (varies by project but typically less than 50%)
  • Availability to work at least 2 days per week in the Fort Worth, TX office when not travelling.
  • US Citizenship is required for this position.

job.title: Sr Java/AWS Developer (34280)
job.description:
Title: Sr Java/AWS Developer
Location: Chicago, IL 60604 (On-site Work)
Duration: 12 Months Contract with Possible Extension

NOTE: Looking for W2 candidates only.
  •  Candidate must be USC or GCH (At least 2 years of US resident after receiving Green Card), requires ANACI clearance

Required top 3 hard skills:
  • Full Stack Java Developer (Java, Angular, AWS and RDS)
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required
  • 7-10 years’ experience required.

Job Description:
One of our direct clients is looking for a Sr. Full Stack Java Developer (Java, Angular, AWS and RDS).

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
• Hands on experience in developing and successful deployment of large scale projects from end-to-end.
• Evaluates, designs, and implements complex modifications to existing applications to accommodate changes in user requirements of hardware/software infrastructure
• Collaborates with Project Management, Business and Systems Analysts and leadership by recommending specifications for system enhancements for continuous functional improvement
• Produces technical documentation that accurately and thoroughly depicts the software design and code base
• Maintains robust understanding of business processes and needs in order to deliver accurate solutions
• Develops, maintains, and enhances high quality software code in accordance with established organization standards and development guidelines
• May review, perform testing, and provide feedback on the work of Application Developers
• Provides primary or backup support to resolve production problems and processing issues
• Hands-on experience in following the iterative and agile SDLC process.
Must have experience building public facing applications using:
• Object Oriented Analysis and Design
• AWS Services - Lambda, DynamoDB, S3, VPC, API Gateway, ECR , RDS
• CICD Pipeline
• Terraform
• Typescript
• Java, Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Hibernate, Rest API\
• Docker
• RDBMS
• Git

job.title: Staff Project Controls Specialist (34284)
job.description:
Staff Project Controls Specialist
Location: Phoenix, AZ
Pay: $35 - $60 / hr
Benefits: Access to Benefits Package

The Staff Project Controls Specialist will be responsible for leading project controls processes with the internal project management team to execute project deliverables within budget and schedule.

  • Ensure project set-up in the Enterprise Planning & Controls software.
  • Analyze data, review logs, and run reports in the Enterprise Planning & Controls software or other tools. (Proficiency in Primavera P6 is desirable)
  • Create Work Breakdown Structure (WBS).
  • Develop, implement, and maintain effective scheduling reports, cost reports, cash flows and forecasts for multiple projects.
  • Follow project execution plans.
  • Responsible for engineering, procurement and construction planning, scheduling, logistics and cost control.
  • Serve as a point of contact for technical questions from the project team.
  • Approve Purchase Orders and/or Subcontracts for proper coding.
  • Input and document changes to cost reports or forecasts.
  • Interface with the Project Management Team and Accounting Department to review project costs and contingency costs and support external audits.
  • Review upstream (prime contract) and downstream (purchase order & subcontract) change orders.
  • Develop and present a cash flow report.
  • Develop various levels of schedules.
  • Perform field progress measurements.
  • Perform Earned Value measurements.
  • Maintain projects’ key performance Indicators.
  • Apply and review the entry of logic ties within the schedules.
  • Monitor resource loading of a schedule.
  • Support Project Planning Meetings.
  • Create various schedule reports and determine appropriate reporting format.
  • Develop, review, and analyze pre-programmed project scheduling reports and back-up documentation for accuracy.
  • Consult with the project team on schedule progress.
  • Analyze and evaluate schedule management involving the critical path method of scheduling techniques, estimating, project cost management and forecasting.
  • Perform schedule what-if scenarios.
  • Develop and maintain an earned value management system.
  • Input and validate progress measurement.
  • Develop and maintain progress curves.
  • Perform material takeoffs.
  • Perform quality checks and inspections on project controls deliverables.
  • Perform field audits to validate accuracy of reporting and processes.
  • Capable of assisting with Project Forensic Analysis.

 

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Construction management or related field.
  • 3 years of direct project controls experience.
  • Applicable experience may be substituted for the degree requirement.
  • Experience with Oracle Primavera P6 preferred.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office.
  • Proficient with PowerBi.
  • OSHA 10-hour safety certification OR the ability to obtain.

job.title: Infrastructure Manager - Linux Subject Matter Expert (34285)
job.description:
The Manager will serve as a Linux Subject Matter Expert (SME), responsible for monitoring, maintaining, troubleshooting, and supporting high-performance computing (HPC) nodes that are critical to our client’s day-to-day operations. The role focuses on ensuring a secure, optimized, and highly available HPC environment, while delivering deep technical expertise and guidance to users and internal teams.
Candidates must be able to work onsite at least 4 days per week.
Key Responsibilities
  • Act as the primary technical expert for Linux-based HPC clusters – ensuring performance, capacity, and availability targets are met.
  • Identify, diagnose, and resolve complex second-level issues for hardware, software, network, VPN, and Linux environments; escalate as needed with full documentation.
  • Manage daily operations of Linux-based HPC environments, including patching, upgrades, security hardening, and configuration of Ubuntu and RedHat systems.
  • Support job submission and workload management using Slurm or OpenHPC, and assist end users in optimizing compute workloads.
  • Migrate existing nodes to Linux, ensuring minimal downtime and performance impact.
  • Implement and manage cluster patching/automation tools such as Foreman (or similar) to streamline operations.
  • Install and configure servers, storage, hypervisors (KVM), and other HPC infrastructure components.
  • Automate administrative tasks to improve operational efficiency.
  • Execute firewall access requests, monitor security alerts, and assist in incident response.
  • Provide second-level support and mentorship to junior technical staff, ensuring knowledge transfer and consistent process execution.
  • Develop, maintain, and publish technical documentation, KB articles, and end-user guides for new systems or upgrades.
  • Participate in on-call rotations, emergency incident response, and occasional after-hours maintenance windows.
Education & Experience
  • Diploma or Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • Minimum 2+ years in IT (with a related University Degree) or 7+ years in IT (with a three-year College Diploma).
  • Enterprise-level Linux expertise (Ubuntu and/or RedHat) is essential.
  • Certifications (e.g., MCSE, CISSP) are strong assets.
Specialized Skills
  • Proven track record as a Linux SME in installation, tuning, and operational support.
  • In-depth experience with HPC clusters and job scheduling tools such as Slurm, LSF, or GridEngine.
  • Strong knowledge of KVM or similar hypervisors.
  • Working understanding of network systems, protocols, and standards including Active Directory integration.
  • Identity management experience (Microsoft Identity Manager, Azure AD Connect).
  • Solid scripting skills (Bash required; additional scripting languages are an asset).
  • Experience applying advanced troubleshooting to resolve performance, configuration, or security issues.
  • Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and documentation skills.
  • Ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Bilingualism (English/French) is an asset.
  • Microsoft Windows knowledge is an asset.
Decision Making & Supervision
  • Operate with minimal supervision while making decisions based on analysis, troubleshooting, and established procedures.
  • Coordinate with helpdesk, networking, platform, and security teams to ensure alignment of upgrades, patches, and operations.
Working Conditions
  • Comfortable office environment with periodic physical tasks (e.g., installing hardware).
  • Requires appropriate security clearance.
  • Must be willing to provide occasional off-hours support and participate in on-call rotation.

Document Control Assistant

The Document Control Assistant will assist the document control team and Project Managers to deliver quality materials and input information on engineering projects.

job.title: Lab Quality Control Technician (34289)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Quality Control Lab Technician for a 6 months contract.  Extensions are likely up to 3 years.  This is an on-site role. 

XS Energy Quality Control Lab Technician
What is special about this role:

As a XS QA lab technician, you will ensure XS Energy Drinks meet the chemical specification requirements by performing Wet Chemistry and Sensory testing. You will have responsibilities related to testing and evaluation, investigation support, laboratory maintenance, environmental monitoring, and other duties. As a part of the high functioning team, you will work in both group and autonomous circumstances while working on-site together. Your ability to work collaboratively will be valued in this role as you work with cross-functional peers in quality and manufacturing to ensure product quality.

Roles & Responsibilities:
• Conduct quality testing on in-process and finished product in the XS plant • Assay and sensory analysis of liquid CO2
• Testing includes use of titrators, density meters, x-rays, and other general laboratory equipment
• Perform taste/odor/appearance evaluation on samples throughout production
• Work both independently as well as with manufacturing
• Communicate with manufacturing when in-process adjustments are required
• Maintain laboratory work area and assist with general laboratory cleaning
• Inventory management Skills to be successful in this role:
• Experience with performing wet chemistry, physical, sensory tests, and can seam testing
• Attention to detail to follow standard operating procedures, safety requirements, test procedures and current good manufacturing practices (cGMP)
• Ability to offer recommendations for continuous improvements
• Talent to prioritize work effectively and complete work efficiently meeting high quality standards
• A desire for a sense of ownership and to be an ambassador of Quality to
Manufacturing

Hours of Operation:
• 1 st shift: 6am-4:30pm Monday-Thursday

job.title: Records Technician (34291)
job.description:
Records Technician
Location: Marysville, OH
Pay: $23.50 / hr

Responsibilities
 
  • Under general supervision, responsible for supporting Records Management with established processes.
  • The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, data processing, and advanced Excel spreadsheet formula experience as well as PowerBI.
  • This role will involve analyzing large datasets, creating detailed reports, and providing actionable insights to support business decisions.
  • Occasional support of pickup, delivery of retrieved records and sending offsite records for Client departments.
  • Ensuring chain of custody is followed and maintain the confidentiality of records as well as updating the location of records in the system.
  • Provide support prepping and quality checking records as required.
  • Verify and document records stored by following established cataloging system.
  • Assist with digitizing, retrieving and working closely with Department Records Representatives to retrieve and store department records.
  • Assist with physical records management by ensuring inventory accuracy, analyzing large datasets, and support the disposal process of records eligible for destruction.
  • Develop and maintain complex Excel spreadsheets, including advanced formulas, pivot tables, and macros.
  • Provide support / guidance for delivery and pick-up of records with current vendors.
  • Able to manage their own project load, multitask & prioritize accordingly.
  • Ensure Departments are following the Company Policy on Document Retention and maintain Confidentiality of documents

Qualifications
 
  • High School diploma.
  • Minimum of 3 years in a professional office environment.
  • Analytical skills with the ability to use O365 for data analysis and research.
  • Able to meet deadlines and understand time issues.
  • Prioritize and work with co-workers, supervisors, and customers.
  • Resolve customer issues and take responsibility for work performed.
  • Knowledge of records software systems, scanners, filling, storage and disposal procedures.
  • Expert proficiency in computer skills, especially when using records tracking system or quick retrieval filling & storage of files
  • Proficiency in MS Excel, Pivot Tables, Formulas, PowerBI
  • Good communication skills (written, read, and verbal)

Physical Demands:
 
  • Physical Activity required, including bending, reaching, lifting, and prolonged periods of standing.
  • May lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

job.title: Technical Architect (34292)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Technical Architect to design and implement robust technology architectures, frameworks, and strategies that align with business objectives and application requirements. The successful candidate will evaluate solutions, ensure integration across systems, and provide leadership in adopting emerging technologies, while mentoring and guiding teams to build sustainable and scalable solutions. This role requires Canadian Government Secret Clearance at minimum.

Key Responsibilities

  • Architecture & Strategy: Develop technical architectures, frameworks, and strategies to address organizational and major application needs.

  • Policy Alignment: Identify and interpret the policies, standards, and requirements that influence solution design.

  • Solution Evaluation: Analyze and assess alternative technology solutions to determine the most effective approach to business challenges.

  • Integration Leadership: Ensure seamless integration of all components within technology solutions.

  • Trend Monitoring: Stay current with industry and government technology trends to align solutions with evolving directions.

  • Innovation & Emerging Tech: Provide insight, direction, and support for the adoption of emerging technologies.

  • Impact Analysis: Conduct impact assessments of proposed technology changes on systems and operations.

  • Support & Guidance: Collaborate with application development and technical support teams to ensure optimal use of infrastructure.

  • Standards & Performance: Review application and infrastructure designs for compliance with standards, recommending enhancements for performance and scalability.

  • Executive Communication: Assist in the preparation of materials and deliver presentations to senior leadership as required.

  • Mentorship & Collaboration: Coach, mentor, and collaborate with colleagues to enhance organizational capability in architecture and solution development.

Qualifications

  • Proven experience as a Technical Architect, Solutions Architect, or related senior technical role.

  • Strong knowledge of enterprise architecture frameworks, IT standards, and best practices.

  • Expertise in analyzing complex business problems and designing scalable technology solutions.

  • Familiarity with emerging technologies, cloud computing, integration platforms, and IT governance.

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with experience influencing senior leadership.

  • Demonstrated ability to mentor, coach, and collaborate effectively across teams.

  • Must hold active Canadian Government Secret Clearance.

Preferred Skills

  • Experience working in public sector or regulated industries.

  • Knowledge of compliance, data security, and government IT standards.

  • Professional certifications in architecture (e.g., TOGAF, Zachman, AWS/Azure Architect) are an asset.

job.title: Project Manager (34293)
job.description:
We are seeking an experienced Project Manager to oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of technology projects that align with organizational objectives and government standards. The Project Manager will ensure integration across technical solutions, monitor industry trends, and support the adoption of emerging technologies while managing resources, schedules, risks, and stakeholder communication. This role requires Canadian Government Secret Clearance at minimum.

Key Responsibilities

  • Project Planning & Strategy: Develop project plans, frameworks, and delivery strategies to meet business and application requirements.

  • Policy & Compliance: Identify policies, standards, and requirements that guide project execution and ensure compliance.

  • Solution Analysis: Coordinate the evaluation of alternative technology solutions to resolve business challenges.

  • Integration Oversight: Ensure project deliverables support the integration of all aspects of technology solutions.

  • Trend Awareness: Monitor industry and government technology trends to ensure projects remain aligned with future directions.

  • Innovation Support: Provide direction on incorporating emerging technologies within project scope.

  • Impact Assessment: Oversee impact analysis of proposed technology or project changes on timelines, scope, and resources.

  • Team Support: Collaborate with technical teams to ensure projects leverage existing infrastructure effectively.

  • Quality Assurance: Review designs, deliverables, and outcomes to ensure adherence to standards and recommend improvements.

  • Executive Reporting: Prepare reports, briefings, and presentations for senior leadership and project stakeholders.

  • Leadership & Mentorship: Coach, mentor, and guide project teams to foster collaboration, accountability, and knowledge transfer.

Qualifications

  • Proven experience as a Project Manager, Program Manager, or in a leadership role overseeing technology projects.

  • Strong understanding of IT infrastructure, solution delivery, and enterprise systems.
  • Strong experience using Azure DevOps. 

  • Demonstrated ability to manage complex projects with multiple stakeholders in government or regulated environments.

  • Familiarity with emerging technologies, cloud platforms, and IT governance standards.

  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills with experience engaging senior leadership.

  • Strong leadership, mentoring, and team-building capabilities.

  • Must hold active Canadian Government Secret Clearance.

Preferred Skills

  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or equivalent.

  • Experience with Agile, Waterfall, or hybrid project management methodologies.

  • Experience working on Government of Canada IT projects or in regulated industries.

  • Knowledge of compliance, data security, and federal IT standards.

job.title: Quality Lab Tech Sampler (34296)
job.description:
QA Lab Technician Sampler
Onsite - Ada, MI
Contract - $16/hr. W2

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Company) has a large, direct client in Ada, MI seeking a QA Lab Technician Sampler.  This is an hourly paid position on a W2 contract.  Initial contract terms is 6 months, with GREAT potential for multi-year extension/s.

Description:

The sampling position would include sampling all raw material and packaging components in several warehouses. The raw material sampling would include materials that are used in the cosmetic and home care products, as well as materials that are used in the food industry including allergens. The packaging components would be sampled in the warehouse and this would include inspecting the shipment for defective components.

The materials that are sampled are logged in the QA data system where sampling data is entered. The samples are then delivered to the respective labs including micro, chemistry and packaging. This is NOT a QA laboratory job but may lead to opportunities to gain laboratory experience.

Requirements:

- A valid State of Michigan driver’s license. Candidate will be driving around complex.
- Basic computer skills.
- Science background or science degree is preferred but not required.

job.title: Data Engineer/Scientist (34299)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Data Scientist/Engineer (100% REMOTE).
Duration: 4 Months Contract (Possible further extension)

Must-Have Skills Set/Experience:
  1. Strong experience in Data Engineering, (experience with big data technologies: hive, hadoop, cloudera, dataIQ).
  2. Good in Data Strategies and descriptive analysis
  3. Strong PYTHON
  4. Strong SQL
  5. Data Science, Statistical methods, machine learning, natural language processing.

Work Distribution:
  • 50% - Data Engineering, Descriptive Analysis & Data Strategies (manage large datasets, data pipelines, and performing descriptive analytics).
  • 25% - Building Dashboard, and Data visualization
  • 25% - Applying Data Science techniques

Job Description:
The successful Data Scientist/Engineer will translate business needs into analytic questions; conduct data exploration and model specification; mange data flows and ETL operations; visualize data into dashboards; design and perform analyses of operational, transactional, and log data; and translate these analytic findings into leading information and metrics for our business partners. The chosen candidate would be able to take on responsibilities spanning multiple disciplines across data engineering, data science and analytics programming.

Job Responsibilities:
• Consult with internal and external stakeholders to determine how best to apply analytical solutions that support business objectives
• Work closely with product managers, analysts, and other stakeholders to provide reliable data deliverables
• Build and maintain scalable data pipelines. Develop, optimize, and manage ETL processes for structured and unstructured data
• Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security across various platforms
• Implement data quality checks and monitor pipeline performance
• Collaborate in cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Cloudera, Dataiku, etc.) and with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop)
• Demonstrate a basic knowledge of data science related concepts (i.e. predictive analytics, unsupervised learning, machine learning, deep learning) and how to use them for solving real world problems
• Adhere to agile project management frameworks and set the direction of data science initiatives
• Effectively communicate technical concepts to a non-analytic audience

Required Qualifications/Experience:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, or related field with ?3 years of relevant professional work experience with an outstanding track record
• Proficiency in Python and SQL is required. Knowledge of R programming is a plus.
• Practical experience with data science techniques and toolkits, including times series forecasting, machine learning, deep learning, and LLMs
• Familiarity with navigating in both a relational (Teradata-based) and non-relational (Hadoop) environment. Knowledge of Java/Scala/Apache Spark is a bonus
• Practiced in exploratory data analysis (EDA) and manipulating large data sets
• Good interpersonal skills and ability to present technical concepts to business stakeholders
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Self-starter and intellectually curious with a strong desire to improve business processes through innovation
• Motivated to gain the full business understanding behind each analytical request

job.title: Security (Network) Architect (34300)
job.description:
Responsibilities
  • Lead the design, development, and implementation of secure network and infrastructure architectures.
  • Assess current security posture and provide recommendations for improvements across network, cloud, and hybrid environments.
  • Define and document security architectural standards, roadmaps, and reference models.
  • Collaborate with solution architects, infrastructure teams, and business stakeholders to ensure security is embedded in all technology solutions.
  • Evaluate emerging security tools, technologies, and processes for enterprise adoption.
  • Conduct threat modeling, risk assessments, and gap analyses for new and existing systems.
  • Ensure compliance with security standards, regulatory requirements, and best practices (NIST, ISO 27001, CIS, Zero Trust).
  • Support incident response planning and provide architecture guidance during investigations.


Experience/Skills:
  • 8+ years of progressive IT experience with a focus on security architecture and network security.

  • Strong understanding of compliance/regulatory frameworks (PCI-DSS, SOX, GDPR, HIPAA, etc.).

job.title: Plant Engineering / Automation Lead - Operational Technology (OT) Migration (31954)
job.description:
Our client in the health care space is looking for a Plant Engineering / Automation Lead to support a critical Operational Technology (OT) Migration Project. This role focuses on overseeing the migration of plant systems and shop floor networks, coordinating suppliers, and ensuring quality and compliance in a GMP-regulated environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Oversee OT migration of approximately 30 systems, including implementing a new shop floor network and expanding the Local Computer Room (LCR).
  • Engage and coordinate with multiple system and application suppliers for seamless migration.
  • Define scope of services for migration of shop floor systems to new infrastructure.
  • Participate in design reviews for systems such as Rockwell & Delta.
  • Supervise and verify supplier milestone completions for system migrations.
  • Collaborate with the Quality/Change Control team to ensure compliance and alignment with GMP regulations.
  • Plan and coordinate application migration in alignment with the plant’s production outage schedule.
  • Assist in planning and executing the shop floor network upgrade and LCR expansion.
  • Participate in shop floor network segmentation and VLAN discussions.
  • Coordinate with infrastructure, cyber security, and supplier teams to ensure network and LCR installation.
  • Assist in procurement for infrastructure assets, such as racks and enclosures.

Qualifications:

  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Experience: 10+ years in plant system implementation and OT within a production facility, preferably in a life sciences manufacturing or vaccine production environment.
  • In-depth understanding of Shop Floor Networking, process control/automation, and GMP-regulated manufacturing systems.
  • Automation/Control Technologies: Proficient with PLC, SCADA/HMI, Building Management Systems (BMS), and Process Data Historians.
  • Familiarity with plant system suppliers such as Rockwell FactoryTalk/Plant PAx, Aveva PI, and Delta BMS.
  • Strong coordination skills with a track record of managing multiple suppliers and maintaining compliance with quality standards.
  • Excellent communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills.

job.title: Electrical Engineering Team Lead (34302)
job.description:
Job Title: Electrical Engineering Team Lead

Compensation: $190K–$195K
Location: Ohio (Wadsworth, Columbus) Hybrid
No sponsorship At This Time
Benefits: Access to Client Benefits Package

Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled Electrical Engineering Leader to provide expert technical guidance and oversight of an electrical engineering group. This role involves managing an industrial engineering team and delivering a variety of design projects for the chemical, power, utilities, and manufacturing industries.

The ideal candidate will have experience designing and retrofitting industrial power distribution systems and substations, combined with strong leadership skills and the ability to drive innovation in electrical engineering practices.

Key Responsibilities

  1. Team Leadership – Supervise, mentor, and guide a team of industrial electrical engineers, supporting technical growth and project delivery.
  2. Technical Oversight – Provide expert direction on complex electrical system designs to ensure project success.
  3. Compliance & Quality – Review designs for compliance with federal, state, and local regulations while ensuring company policies, quality, and best practices are upheld.
  4. Client Engagement – Act as a primary technical contact for clients, reviewing project needs, providing technical guidance, and building strong client relationships.
  5. Site Reviews – Conduct site visits and studies to validate design requirements and ensure alignment with project specifications.
  6. Knowledge Development – Create white papers, technical documentation, and presentations; contribute thought leadership at conferences and industry events.
  7. Proposals & Collaboration – Partner with internal teams to prepare proposals and respond to RFPs.
  8. Mentorship – Train and mentor junior engineers to support their career growth.
  9. Project Management – Provide timely updates, ensure budgets/schedules are met, and manage overall project delivery.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Electronic Engineering, Electrical Technology, or related field.
  • Professional Engineering (PE) license (minimum 12+ years required).
  • 15+ years of related experience in electrical engineering, consulting, and design.
  • Expert knowledge of electrical engineering principles and design practices.
  • Strong background in power utility projects (transmission, substations, distribution).
  • Domestic and/or international travel as required (based on project demands).

Preferred Qualifications

  • Proven leadership experience overseeing teams of electrical engineers.
  • Experience with FEL, FEED, progressive design-build, and design-build delivery methods.
  • Strong project budgeting and scheduling experience.
  • Ability to obtain licensing in multiple states.
  • Skilled at developing engineering estimates and maintaining client confidence.
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills.

Skills & Abilities

  • Expert knowledge of electrical engineering principles and design practices.
  • Proficiency with power system studies, Microsoft Office software, and CADD (3D & 4D).
  • Strong understanding of federal, state, and local regulations impacting electrical design.
  • Ability to lead projects from design through completion while mentoring staff.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.
